intro: Ranunculus stellaris, commonly known as the star ranunculus, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, five-petaled flowers that resemble stars, typically in shades of white, yellow, or pink. The plant grows from a rhizome and has trifoliate leaves with a hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a striking visual element to its natural habitat.
